labels.analysis: The MCP Server is focused on providing cost exploration capabilities for cloud computing services. The 'get-cost' tool specifically retrieves cloud cost summaries across multiple vendors and time periods. This indicates the server's primary function is centered around financial tracking, analysis, and cost management for cloud infrastructure.
labels.reasoning: The primary label 'Financial Services' was chosen because the server provides financial tracking and analysis of cloud costs. The secondary label 'Cloud Services' was added since the tool specifically deals with cloud vendor cost data. No custom label is needed as the predefined labels adequately cover the server's functionality.

tools.name: get-cost
tools.description: Get cloud cost summary for multiple vendors and months

months.description: List of months in YYYY-MM format (e.g. ['2024-04', '2024-05'])

server_info_crawled.name: OpsNow Cost MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @taejulee/opsnow-mcp-cost-server-no-server
server_info_crawled.overview: This is a Proof of Concept (PoC) project by OpsNow to provide cost exploration capabilities through Claude MCP (Model Context Protocol).

tools.name: get-cost
tools.description: Get cloud cost summary for multiple vendors and months

months.description: List of months in YYYY-MM format (e.g. ['2024-04', '2024-05'])

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@taejulee/opsnow-mcp-cost-server-no-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
